page.title: 11The Environment
page.content:
Originally most of the area of Eltham was woodland except for an area of sandy soil on which the first settlement in Eltham developed.In the middle ages the woodland became royal forest.By the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries much of the woodland had been cleared for farming purposes.By the late nineteenth century Eltham was being developed as a residential area.Today Eltham is a densely populated residential suburb of London.Population approximately 73,000.
Pupils-Crown Woods School.
